title.narrative: WASH IN SCHOOL AND KINDERGARTEN

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, increased national and sub-national capacity to provide equitable access to sustainable drinking water and adequate sanitation in schools., which contributes to Hygiene, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Sanitation, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equitable access to Child-Friendly Schools that are inclusive, academically effective, gender-sensitive, healthy, safe protective, and involve families and communities

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, increased national and sub-national capacity to provide equitable access to sustainable drinking water andadequate sanitation in schools.

description.narrative: Local governments' implementation of the national WASH norms and requirements in 19 schools, 30 dormitories, and four kindergartens in two focus areas, following UNICEF Mongolia's technical and financial support, resulted to 100 per cent coverage in access to safe water and adequate sanitation for approximately 16,200 boys and girls. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: Percentage of schools and kindergartens with improved water and sanitation facilities

target.value: 2016:80% of targeted schools in Khuvsgul and Nalaikh

actual.value: 2017:100% of target schools and kindergartens in Khuvsgul and Nalaikh have access to improved water and sanitation facilities.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Primary schools that have WASH facilities meeting national standards

baseline.value: 27 % (73% have outdoor latrines by MECS,2007 Study)

title.narrative: Prevalence of handwashing at critical times of the day by students at the national level and in focus areas

actual.value: 2017:At least 80% of school children have practice of handwashing in Khuvsgul and Nalaikh.

title.narrative: Percentage of household with a place for hand washing available at national level
Existence of a national plan with target to provide access to drinking water to unserved populations

baseline.value: Exist National Programme on Water (with 2 phases: 2010-2015 and 2016-2021), However, no plan for equity water supply.

actual.value: 2017:Equitable water tariffing methodology revision is underway.

title.narrative: Percentage of target schools that have policies or plans that include targets for WASH
Percentage of schools (including dormitories) and kindergartens in target sites that have access to improved WASH facilities, meeting nationally defined minimum requirements (standards)
Percentage of target soums that have water safety plans adopted by the local Government
National standards for WASH in schools with a disability component available
